definition: to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)

sentences.english: Can you pick up London on the radio?
sentences.chinese: 你的收音机能收听到伦敦的电台吗？

sentences.english: He felt browned off when he heard that he waw dismissed.
sentences.chinese: 当他听到自己被解职时感到很不痛快。

sentences.english: He heard the contents of the glass being poured into the sink .
sentences.chinese: 他听到杯中物被倒进水盆里。

sentences.english: Elisa started at the sound of her husband's voice.
sentences.chinese: 听到丈夫的声音，伊利莎吃了一惊。

sentences.english: In the fall we sometimes hear honks as a flock of geese flies south.
sentences.chinese: 到了秋天，有时我们能听到南飞雁群的叫声。

sentences.english: I hear as if sing lonely to me.
sentences.chinese: 我徬佛听到寂寞怼莪唱歌。

sentences.english: I 'm very excited to hear Dr. Gambol 's talk.
sentences.chinese: 我很兴奋能听到甘博博士讲话。

sentences.english: The brawl in the street could be heard in the house nearby .
sentences.chinese: 在附近的房子里都能听到街上的争吵声。

sentences.english: Hey fellas have you heard the news?
sentences.chinese: 嘿家伙你听到这个消息？

sentences.english: So long as opens the mouth to sing, lengthens until the dream, hears the echo to be resonant.
sentences.chinese: 只要开口唱，直到梦想延长，听到回音多嘹亮。

sentences.english: I've only Listend acres his accident.
sentences.chinese: 我刚听到他的一些情况。

sentences.english: On WHT and many other places, you only hear about it when it messes up.
sentences.chinese: 在西隧和许多其他地方，你只能听到它时它弄乱。

sentences.english: How do we hear chord progressions?
sentences.chinese: 我们要怎样才能听到和弦进行？

sentences.english: I could hear the door banging in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 我能听到门被风吹得直响。

sentences.english: We were overjoyed at the news of China haying launched another man-made satellite.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到中国又发射了一颗人造卫星时都很高兴。

sentences.english: One day while a rabbit was walking by a hill he heard someone calling.
sentences.chinese: 一天当兔子在山角下散步时，听到有人在呼救。

definition: to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
(of a sound) to come through/to be heard/(of news) to arrive
to yell/to shout/to call out for (a person)
first tone in Mandarin (high, level tone)
to recall/to think of/to call to mind
to think of/to call to mind/to anticipate
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
